text: Ira Pastan (born June 1, 1931) is an American scientist. He works at the National Cancer Institute. Pastan was born in Winthrop, Massachusetts. He is a member of the National Academy of Sciences.Pastan, I. and Perlman, R.L.: Cyclic adenosine monophosphate in bacteria. (Review-lead article). Science 169: 339-344, 1970 He is also a Fellow of the AAAS and the American Society of Microbiology.Pastan, I. and Perlman, R.L: The role of the lac promoter locus in the regulation of β-galactosidase synthesis by cyclic 3′,5′-AMP.
